Line 194: Line 194:
===Covert "mining"===
===Covert "mining"===
In June, 2011, [[Symantec]] warned about the possibility of [[botnet]]s engaging in covert "mining" of bitcoins (unauthorized use of resources of computers to generate bitcoins).<ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/bitcoin-botnet-mining</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.com/blog/security/researchers-find-malware-rigged-with-bitcoin-miner/8934</ref> As a virus, such a program would consume computing cycles and use extra electricity. Later that month, an employee of the [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] was caught after using the company's servers to mine bitcoins without permission.<ref>http://thenextweb.com/au/2011/06/23/abc-employee-caught-mining-for-bitcoins-on-company-servers/</ref>
In June, 2011, [[Symantec]] warned about the possibility of [[botnet]]s engaging in covert "mining" of bitcoins (unauthorized use of resources of computers to generate bitcoins).<ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/bitcoin-botnet-mining</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.com/blog/security/researchers-find-malware-rigged-with-bitcoin-miner/8934</ref> As a virus, such a program would consume computing cycles and use extra electricity. Later that month, an employee of the [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] was caught after using the company's servers to mine bitcoins without permission.<ref>http://thenextweb.com/au/2011/06/23/abc-employee-caught-mining-for-bitcoins-on-company-servers/</ref>
â   â
The increasing difficulty of Bitcoin mining makes any use of computers lacking the most powerful [[GPU]]s less and less profitable. Larger and larger botnets would be needed to compete. Also, equipment owners might notice their systems running slower and hotter than normal.
